credentials: PHD 1988 Univ of Maryland College Park
name: John Gubner

ratings.comment: His lectures are really difficult to follow and he seems to lecture as if you already know the material and he is just reviewing it. 3 tricky exams of 4-5 questions determine 60% of your grade. That being said, he is highly knowledgeable, and curves well. I think most students got A or AB. The course is just needlessly stressful due to logistics.

The guy doesn't do anything. You will have to teach yourself the subject, and the exams are 75% of your grade. There is no partial credit, and your most likely going to get most of the questions wrong. If you take this class with John Gubner you will want to drop out the moment you step foot into class on day one. Best of luck.

FOR ECE 230

I took this class during the summer to get it out of the way. Even though it is extremely fast paced, the professor is really helpful. He responds very fast to homework questions via email and is flexible with appointments. He also holds virtual office hours all day the day before the exam. The exams are not unreasonable either.
he's kind of mean :(

THIS REVIEW IS FOR ECE252. Was online. Everytime I needed help I would email him and he would respond within 30 minutes and setup an appointment that day. Always very helpful during the appointments, and would take the time to ensure I understood everything.

He is a very nice professor and is very eager to help. You can ask any questions, including stupid questions, and he would still explain it to you patiently. But his lectures are very dry, hard to understand, and impossible to follow. You have to learn most of the course from textbooks. And he is a tough grader. He fails lots of people.

It is a graduate-level course, don't expect it to be easy. Dr. Gubner is a tough grader, who wants your answers to be really precise on your tests and takes them seriously. Understanding the fundamentals is very important to do well in this class and it might be a lot of work. He is a really nice person and will clarify your doubts in class.
If you enjoy a bellow average video lectures without any examples present in them, this is the professor for you.

If you get a chance to talk to him 1 on 1, he's a very nice guy and pretty helpful. But his lectures are incredibly dry.  If you don't already know what he's talking about before you come in, you won't understand what he's doing.  There are also basically three homework assignments each week, which is a little excessive. Tests are full of tricks.

The worst professor. This course is like a math course. He spent most of the time proving and manipulating formula. Just speak in a way that  only he can understand. Lab consumes too much time. Homework is tricky and doesn't give any hint after you check. It seems like he doesn't care if his students can learn something from this course. Worst!

He is the worst professor i have ever had. He either has no idea how to teach, or just doesn't care if his students are following his painfully-dry, proof-heavy lectures. You WILL have to learn the material outside of his lectures, regardless of what he claims. In addition, the labs require far more time than they are scheduled for.

From a theoretical perspective, the material in this class is not very difficult. However, this professors lectures are very dry, focus mainly on derivations, and he does not provide much practice material. Office hours were helpful, but the very way material was presented made this class more difficult than it needed to be.
Avoid

One of the worst professors I've had. Tests are crazy difficult and questions are far too specific. Boring, poorly organized lectures and labs that do not further your understanding of the class or help on the test.

He is absolutely the least involved professor I have encountered to date. His notes are poorly hand-written, disorganized, incomplete, and sometimes inaccurate. There isn't enough room here for my all the reasons he is a terrible professor. I would be shocked if he cares at all whether or not his students learn the material.

Professor Gubner can seem dry, but he has his own sense of humor. Go to office hours, he's very helpful. He doesn't seem to outright say what you're meant to take away from his explanation, which can make the class frustrating because you can't seem to pick up what he's putting down, but just keep asking. And do practice problems.

He is quite passionate about the material, but I have never been to a worse lecture. His material is disorganized, he speaks incredibly quietly, he rarely interprets student questions correctly, and it seems like very little preparation is done for his lectures. As for the labs, expect that 50-minute scheduled lab to take upwards of 2 hours.

He is probably my least favorite professor I have had in my time in college. I stopped attending class after the first midterm and just taught myself the class material with the online lectures from another professor.

Notes, lectures, homeworks, labs, and practice exams were taken from last semester. Did a few things to make the  class better, not much though. Wasn't a clear lecturer, exams hardly followed homeworkpractice or were too specific. He was willing to be helpful, even when you waited until the last minute, however. Overall a bad professor though.
Worst professor I've had at UW. Awful teaching style, avoid at all costs.

John Gubner's teaching style is boring and his homework assignments will fool you into thinking that the tests will be easy. Asking questions for clarification during lecture is pointless because he depends entirely on his notes to teach. The online "notes" are messily handwritten and impossible to read. Textbook is a must.

Oh J-Gubes... Tries his best to keep your interest, but he is just not good at clearly explaining the concepts. Reading the textbook is really the only way to learn (even though he advises against that). Tends to test on very specific special cases, instead of the overarching concepts.
Just the worst..

Gubner tries to teach probability to engineers, but takes an excessively mathematical approach that is difficult to digest. There are almost no physical examples, visualizations, or attempts to build intuition. Everything is math, proofs, and theory, while applications are missing. He's at least prepared for class and willing to answer questions.
Please Avoid!!!! His interest level in the class is close to zero. Gives the tricky questions in the test and explains nothing in class

Class material is diverse and very interesting. Gubner is an excellent teacher but Has a difficult time motivating some theory which can be off putting to some engineers. If you like math and working hard you'll enjoy Gubners style. If youre just taking the class to check off the requirement, I am so sorry, good luck.
He is a mathematician doing his best to teach engineers. I think his class and style of teaching are excellent but because he is very theoretical, some engineers may be turned off.
A useless Professor.
